PDF Format

Bhakti yoga is a spiritual path described in Hindu philosophy as efficacious for fostering love of, faith in, and surrender to God.It is a means to realize God,and is the easiest way for the common person because it doesn't involve extensive yogic practices.
The Bhagavad Gita, Bhagavata Purana and Puranas are important scriptures which expound the philosophy of Bhakti.Hindu movements in which bhakti is the main practice are called bhakti movementsÃ¢â‚¬â€the major schools are Vaishnavism, Shaivism, and Shaktism.
